page.title: 07ANIMALS AND INSECTS
page.content: The area supports a wide variety of wild life.The marshy ground and natural ponds provide breeding grounds for a variety of waterlife that includes frogs,toads,newts,insects such as dragonflies,caddisflies,may- flies; and water voles and rats. Foxes make their dens on the old disused sand tips and are known to make raids on poultry houses. Badgers are rarely seen, but there is evidence of their existence from their strong, aromatic territory scents and their droppings. Small rodents, such as shrews, voles and field mice, make their homes in the natural hedges.They are the prey of hawks-sparrow and buzzard.We analysed some kestrel pellets found on a small holding and they contained the fur of rabbits and skeletons of small rodents already mentioned.
